data.title: ‘Super fan’ Michael Rapaport praises controversial Bravolebrities Tom Sandoval, Shannon Beador
data.meta_description: Michael Rapaport revealed which Bravo reality stars are in his "power rankings" this year — including "controversial" names such as Tom Sandoval and Shannon Beador.
data.text:
Michael Rapaport revealed which Bravo reality stars are in his “power rankings” this year — including “controversial” names such as Tom Sandoval and Shannon Beador.

In a new video with Bilt Rewards founder and CEO Ankur Jain, the self-proclaimed Bravo “super fan” listed Mary Cosby, Ariana Madix, Sandoval, Beador and Teresa Giudice in his top five.

The comedian, 53, also revealed which “Real Housewives” star is climbing the ranks.

“The person who is moving up the Bravo power rankings as we speak — Erika Jayne,” he said. “She’s got her residency in Vegas.”

However, Rapaport’s choice of top Bravolebrities may raise some eyebrows given their recent headlines.

Most recently, Beador has been garnering media attention for her DUI arrest.

Page Six confirmed the “Real Housewives of Orange County” star was arrested on Sept. 16 after crashing into a Newport Beach, Calif., home and fleeing the scene.

Beador, 59, was booked on two misdemeanors: hit-and-run and DUI alcohol.

Her lawyer, Michael Fell, later told Page Six that the reality star is “extremely apologetic and remorseful” and “prepared to accept full responsibility” for the accident.

Giudice — another one of Rapaport’s favorites — has also faced legal trouble.

The “Real Housewives of New Jersey” star, 51, previously served 11 months behind bars after she and her ex-husband, Joe Giudice, were convicted on fraud charges.

She was released in December 2015 and later wrote a memoir on her experience in prison.

Meanwhile, “Vanderpump Rules” stars Sandoval, 40, and Madix, 38, were at the center of a highly publicized cheating scandal earlier this year.

The former couple ended their nine-year relationship in March after Sandoval’s affair with Raquel Levis was revealed.

For more Page Six you love…

Listen to our weekly “We Hear” podcast

Shop our exclusive merch

Since the split, the Something About Her sandwich shop owner has acquired various deals and sponsorships, including one with SoFi in which she pretended to move out of the home she still shares with her ex.

On Tuesday, Madix made her debut on “Dancing with the Stars” in a costume version of the red-hot revenge dress she wore during the explosive “Pump Rules” Season 10 reunion episodes.

After sharing his Bravo rankings, Rapaport revealed that he would be attending BravoCon this year.

“BravoCon in Vegas should be a documentary,” he said. “That should be its own show unto itself. BravoCon is three days — I’m going for five.”

BravoCon 2023 will take place in Las Vegas from Nov. 3-5.
